newsitem.title: GERMANY: Waigel welcomes U.S. intention to pay aid arrears.
newsitem.headline: Waigel welcomes U.S. intention to pay aid arrears.

text.p: German Finance Minister Theo Waigel said on Saturday that he welcomed U.S. president Bill Clinton's stated plans to pay off some of the country's arrears to international institutions.
"The determination of the U.S. government gives me confidence," Waigel told a briefing.

Waigel has in the past been quite vocal in criticising the payments policy of the United States, which has fallen behind in payments to the United Nations and also owes funds to the International Monetary Fund's development aid.
In a budget announced this week, Clinton proposed to pay $1.02 billion in arrears for international organisations, of which $964 is for the United Nations.
The plans have to approved by Congress.
